{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is pregnant and planning to travel to Ethiopia, a malaria-endemic region. Therefore, she needs prophylaxis against malaria. However, not all antimalarial drugs are safe during pregnancy. According to Document [31], Chloroquine and Mefloquine are considered safe in all trimesters of pregnancy. Doxycycline is not recommended during pregnancy because it can affect fetal bone growth. Proguanil is not typically used for prophylaxis and is not recommended during pregnancy. Therefore, the most suitable drugs for this patient would be either Chloroquine or Mefloquine.", "answer_choice": "B. Mefloquine"}
